content: A good one. But I agree with JBM, you can remove the "casting renders immobile". Otherwise it seems all good.

I like the idea. This is indeed perfect clash material, and upon cursory glance the tests seem fine.

It seems like the archwizard himself isn't on the battlefield. So I'm not quite sure what the “casting renders immobile” mention brings, if not confusion.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Very cool puzzle! Not too hard and not too easy to resolve.

Funny, it's interesting to think and find an optimized solution.

As a CoC it fails to have an educational purpose, which I think is a shame. Although somehow easy, I think it would make a good Community Puzzle.

Gilsidoo found that it was too difficult for a CoC.
IMHO it's quite the opposite, it's way to easy for a Community Puzzle but the algorithm you provide is rather slow with big datasets.
So it can be interesting with an upgrade for Community Puzzle.

Otherwise I like the idea and it's definitely solvable in less than 5 minutes, I accept this !
kazuma wont help this time xD
Interesting puzzle but a little bit to hard for Clash IMO. I would rather see it in community puzzles (with more efficency constraints)

First time submitting so do give as much feedback as possible! CoC is sorely lacking in the variety of puzzles as many keep repeating. So don't hesitate to comment on anything you like or dislike, so i can make improvements ASAP.

I kept the constraints to a minimum so as to allow even the most inefficient O(n^4) codes to be able to solve it. After all, it's a matter of being able to complete this quickly within the time frame
